articles.title: In Photos: Extravaganza 2016
articles.description: Thousands of students packed Harder Stadium at UCSB on Sunday for Extravaganza, UCSB's annual spring concert.
articles.content:
Thousands of students packed Harder Stadium at UC Santa Barbara on Sunday for Extravaganza, UCSB’s annual spring concert presented by Associated Students Program Board.

Electronic duo ODESZA headlined the show, which also included rap duo Rae Sremmurd, Anderson .Paak, Zella Day and Emancipator.

Photos by Stephen Manga.

Anderson .Paak. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Zella Day. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
The crowd vibes to performers at Extravaganza. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
ODESZA. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Nexus File Photo
Zella Day. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Rae Sremmurd. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
ODESZA. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Swae Lee of Rae Sremmurd. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
ODESZA & Swae Lee of Rae Sremmurd. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Doug Appling of Emancipator. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus

[Correction: A previous version of this article implied that ODESZA and Rae Sremmurd co-headlined. ODESZA was the sole headlining act.]

articles.title: In Photos: Lite the Nite Illuminates Isla Vista
articles.description: More than 200 students and Isla Vistans filled People's Park in Isla Vista Saturday night, playing carnival games, winning prizes and listening to the electronic thumps of multiple DJs.
articles.content:
Organizers estimated more than 2,000 students and Isla Vistans filled People’s Park in Isla Vista Saturday night, playing carnival games, winning prizes and listening to the electronic thumps of multiple DJs.

Blunite and UCSB Ambience hosted Lite the Nite for students and local residents to celebrate the lives of six UCSB students who were killed in Isla Vista by a Santa Barbara City College student on May 23, 2014.

The hundreds of lights in the park Saturday were meant to illuminate “the path between us in light of the darkness that fell over our community in 2014,” according to Blunite’s Facebook page. Read more about what the event means to the organizers here.

Photos by Spencer Brandt and Francisco Barrera.

Francisco Barrera / Daily Nexus

articles.title: In Photos: 31st Annual Santa Barbara International Film Festival
articles.description: Every year, filmmakers, actors and fans head to downtown Santa Barbara for the annual International Film Festival. For two straight weeks, over 200+ films are shown from rising filmmakers. Actors rece...
articles.content:
Every year, filmmakers, actors and fans head to downtown Santa Barbara for the annual International Film Festival. For two straight weeks, over 200+ films are shown from rising filmmakers. Actors receive various awards through tribute events, highlighting their career and past accomplishments. Producers and screenwriters hosts panels for locals to attend. Here is a collection of photos from Daily Nexus photographers who got up close and personal with some of Hollywood’s biggest celebrities.

Photos by Lorenzo Basilio, Cameryn Brock, Riley Esguerra, Stephen Manga

Mackenzie Foy of “The Little Prince” on the red carpet during the opening night of the festival. Cameryn Brock / Daily Nexus
Jeff Bridges and Susan Geston on the red carpet during the opening night of the festival. Cameryn Brock / Daily Nexus
Johnny Depp smirks as he walks down the red carpet. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Johnny Depp accepts the Maltin Modern Master Award for achievement in film. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Director Tom McCarthy and Michael Keaton of Spotlight share a laugh on the red carpet. Lorenzo Basilo / Daily Nexus
Rachel McAdams waves to fans as she arrives at the Arlington Theater. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Rachel McAdams on the red carpet. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Michael Keaton and Rachel McAdams share a laugh with SBIFF director Roger Durling. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Elizabeth Banks on the red carpet. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
Paul Dano. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
Jacob Tremblay honored for his role in Room. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
Alicia Vikander of Ex Machina on the red carpet. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
O’Shea Jackson Jr. of Straight Outta Compton “dabbing” on the red carpet. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
Géza Röhrig of Son of Saul. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
The Virtuosos Award recognize a select group of actors who have distinguished themselves through performances in film this past year.
The writers panel at Lobero Theater. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
The Producers Panel at Lobero Theater. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Saoirse Ronan on the red carpet. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
Saoirse Ronan received the Outstanding Performer of the Year Award for her role in Brooklyn. Riley Esguerra / Daily Nexus
Carl Weathers and Sylvester Stallone, posing on the red carpet before award presentation. Stephen Manga / Daily Nexus
Carl Weathers presenting Sylvester Stallone with the Montecito Award.
Lenny Abrahamson, director of Room. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
George Miller, director of Mad Max: Fury Road. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Tom McCarthy, director of Spotlight. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Alejandro González Iñárritu, director of The Revenant. Alejandro González Iñárritu
Adam McKay, director of The Big Short. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus.
The oscar-nominated directors laugh during a group discussion. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus
Lenny Abrahamsson, Alejandro G. Iñárritu, Tom McCarthy, George Miller, and Adam McKay each received the Outstanding Directors of the Year Award. Lorenzo Basilio / Daily Nexus

articles.title: In Photos: Daily Nexus Welcome to Paradise Carnival
articles.description: On Tuesday, Sept. 22, The Daily Nexus, along with KCSB, hosted the first annual Welcome to Paradise Carnival. Woodstocks provided some dank pizza while FMLYBND gave a stellar show, regardless of their...
articles.content:
On Tuesday, Sept. 22, The Daily Nexus, along with KCSB, hosted the first annual Welcome to Paradise Carnival. Woodstocks provided some dank pizza while FMLYBND gave a stellar show, regardless of their monitors not working. On top of that, there were caricatures, henna, popcorn, cotton candy, a bungee run and a photo booth. Now look at these pictures taken by some dude named Lorenzo.

articles.title: This Year in Photos
articles.description: The Daily Nexus looks back at this year’s highlights, from Nobel Prize winner Shuji Nakamura to the May 23 memorial events that were illuminated by blue LEDs that Nakamura invented. *Correction...
articles.content:
The Daily Nexus looks back at this year’s highlights, from Nobel Prize winner Shuji Nakamura to the May 23 memorial events that were illuminated by blue LEDs that Nakamura invented.

Materials and electrical and computer engineering professor Shuji Nakamura was awarded the 2014 Nobel Prize in Physics on Oct. 7 along with Isamu Akasaki and Hiroshi Amano for the invention of the first blue light-emitting diode (LED). McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Approximately 5,000 students gathered at Storke Plaza on Oct. 8, 2014 for a “Come Together: Remember, Reconnect, & Unite” concert to promote a safer community in commemoration of the six students who lost their lives during the events of May 23 last year. UCSB Alumnus Jack Johnson performed at the event along with several student groups and artists.Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

The Associated Students Program Board hosted alternative rock band Young the Giant in the Thunderdome during a rained-out Halloween night on Oct. 31, 2014. The band performed in adult diapers and bibs, donning costumes to immerse the audience in the spirit of the iconic Isla Vista party weekend. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Students held a rally on Nov. 20, 2014 against proposed tuition hikes by the University of California Board of Regents, which called for an annual 5 percent increase in tuition over the next five years due to a lack of state funding for the UC. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Assemblymember Das Williams introduced Assembly Bill 3 (AB 3) to the California State Assembly on Dec. 1, 2014 to create a Community Services District (CSD) in Isla Vista to provide infrastructure and increased resources to the residents of the community. Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

The Isla Vista Tenants Union (IVTU) announced the beginning of a campaign on Jan. 20, 2015 to provide financial assistance to five households allegedly evicted from Abrego Villas on 6754 and 6764 Abrego Road in I.V. in Oct. 2014. Kenneth Song/Daily Nexus

Beta Theta Pi and Phi Sigma Kappa fraternities lost their charters during the 2014-2015 school year in December and February, respectively, due to various charges concerning alleged violations of university policy. Paris Cullen/Daily Nexus

Students for Justice in Palestine (SJP) installed a mural wall in the Arbor on April 6, 2015 leading up to an A.S. Senate decision on whether to pass a resolution calling for the university to divest from businesses profiting from alleged human rights violations in Palestine. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Two UCSB students were hospitalized after a domestic disturbance which resulted in shots being fired at Sabado Tarde Road on May 11, 2015. Two suspects, 19-year-old Jose Guadalupe Gutierrez of Goleta and 22-year-old James Joshua Taylor of Lompoc, were arrested and booked for charges including attempted murder, robbery and participation in a criminal street gang. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

The annual end-of-the-year Extravaganza concert put on by the A.S. Program Board brought performers Bad Rabbits, AlunaGeorge, Joey Bada$$, Madeon and headliner Miguel to Harder Stadium on May 17, 2015 for a six-hour-long music festival dedicated to a mixture of popular and upcoming artists. Alex Messick/Daily Nexus

Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

Stephen Manga/Daily Nexus

A group of students headed by survivors of sexual assault Alejandra Melgoza, Lexi Weyrick and Melissa Vasquez staged a 13-hour sit-in of Chancellor Henry T. Yang’s office from May 13, 2015 to May 14, 2015 to demand specific policies to improve the handling of sexual assault cases, concluding the night with a signature from Yang ensuring the enactment of 13 sanctions in favor of survivors. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

University administration, Associated Students and several student groups held May 23 memorial events illuminated by Shuji Nakamura’s blue LED lights to unify the community and commemorate the six lives lost in the events of May 23 last year. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

*Correction: A previous version of this article stated professor Shuji Nakamura was a colleague of Isamu Akasaki and Hiroshi Amano. They are co-recipients of the Nobel Prize, but have never worked together; thus, they are not colleagues.

Print

articles.title: In Photos: Candlelit Vigil
articles.description: This Memorial Day weekend, UCSB students and Isla Vista residents honored and remembered the lives of George Chen, Katie Cooper, James Hong, Christopher Martinez, David Wang and Veronika Weiss. The ma...
articles.content:
This Memorial Day weekend, UCSB students and Isla Vista residents honored and remembered the lives of George Chen, Katie Cooper, James Hong, Christopher Martinez, David Wang and Veronika Weiss. The march started from Storke Tower, where a dance piece titled Not One More and an a cappella performance of “Amazing Grace” took place. Everyone was given blue LED candle tea lights as part of the Blunite IV campaign.

Photos by Lorenzo Basilio, McLane Brown and Paris Cullen

Thousands gathers at Storke Plaza just before marching towards Isla Vista. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Paris Cullen/Daily Nexus

A cappella groups performing “Amazing Grace” just under Storke Tower. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

UCSB students and vigil attendees solemnly walk past Storke Tower as they make their way to People’s Park in Isla Vista. Photo Courtesy

Everyone was given blue LED candle tea lights as they marched towards Isla Vista. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Students hold up blue LED candle tea lights as they walk towards People’s Park. Paris Cullen/Daily Nexus

Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Hundreds of paper bags illuminated with blue LED lights were used to mark the path of the march. Photo Courtesy

UCSB students, Isla Vista residents, and other attendees walk past hundreds of paper bags illuminated with blue LED lights, which were used to direct the route of the march. Photo Courtesy

Students and residents gather at People’s Park in Isla Vista. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

UCSB students, Isla Vista residents, and other attendees fill People’s Park before the start of the memorial service to remember the six UCSB students who were murdered one year to this day. Photo Courtesy

Chancellor Yang begins the memorial service at People’s Park. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Family members of those who lost their lives last year sit and wait before they speak. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Kelly Wang, mother of George Chen, speaks in remembrance of her son. McLane Brown/Daily Nexus

Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Isla Vista residents created a memorial in front of IV Deli Mart (lower right) in remembrance of Christopher Martinez. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

articles.title: In Photos: UCSB Photography Club Photo Shootout
articles.description: Last Saturday, April 11, the UCSB Photography Club,  along with local photographers and models, met at the Santa Barbara Shores County Park for their quarterly “Shootout,” where photograp...
articles.content:
Last Saturday, April 11, the UCSB Photography Club,  along with local photographers and models, met at the Santa Barbara Shores County Park for their quarterly “Shootout,” where photographers get hands-on practice photographing portraits, lighting techniques, and general camera usage, while models get free portraits and headshots for professional use.

The Photography Club became an official club at the end of the winter 2015 quarter. The club meets every Tuesday in Girvetz 1119 at 8pm. The president of the club, Alex Gonzalez, is currently a 3rd year biopsychology major, who came up with this idea of a “shootout” when he first started out as a photographer in high school in his hometown, and met with other photographers and honed his skills as a photographer. Alex brought this idea with him with the rest of the club and over the past few months, the club has grown from around 40 members to 250 members. The best way to get involved is to join the the Facebook group, where other members share valuable information, tips, feedback, and even offer classes and workshops for beginning photographers. The group can be found HERE

Below is a sample of the amazing work of Nexus photographers who participated.

Photos by Lorenzo Basilio, McLane Brown, Alex Gonzalez, Christine Skari

Group shot of all the photographers and models who showed up at the spring quarter shootout. Alex Gonzalez/Daily Nexus

articles.title: In Photos: Holi 2015
articles.description: Every year, UCSB Indus hosts the South Asian Festival of Colors, commonly known as Holi. This ancient Hindu religious festival is celebrated all throughout the world. UCSB Indus hosts this festival at...
articles.content:
Every year, UCSB Indus hosts the South Asian Festival of Colors, commonly known as Holi. This ancient Hindu religious festival is celebrated all throughout the world. UCSB Indus hosts this festival at the beach by the Anacapa and Santa Cruz dorms, as thousands of students dance and throw colored powder everywhere. Here are some photos from Daily Nexus photographers who were brave enough to take their camera into the pit.

articles.title: In Photos: Deltopia 2015
articles.description: As spring quarter begins, the students of UCSB prepare for Deltopia, a day of non-stop partying and walking back and forth through the streets of Isla Vista. Along with Deltopia comes a range of event...
articles.content:
As spring quarter begins, the students of UCSB prepare for Deltopia, a day of non-stop partying and walking back and forth through the streets of Isla Vista. Along with Deltopia comes a range of events hosted by UCSB organizations. The Excursion Club hosted First Friday in Perfect Park, while AS Program Board brought Purity Ring to the Thunderdome. On Sunday morning, students and community members helped clean as much trash as possible with tools provided by Adopt-a-Block.

The Excursion Club hosted IV First Friday, with live performances by local Isla Vista bands. Alexander Payne/Daily Nexus

Students and residents of Isla Vista roam Del Playa. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

A student walking down Sabado Tarde throws glitter on a passerby. Vivian Bui/Daily Nexus

Reaching for the win, gauchos race to place Velcro pads while pulled back by a rope. Eric Swenson/Daily Nexus

Local IV Band “Four Closure” performs outside the Thunderdome. Alexander Payne/Daily Nexus

Police mounted on horses stroll through the streets of Isla Vista. Anna Kodelashvili/Daily Nexus

Water bottles were given out to passersby to keep them hydrated during Deltopia. Will Tran/Daily Nexus

Balconies of houses on Del Playa were filled with party-goers. Vivian Bui/Daily Nexus

Chancellor Yang and Dilling Yang walk through Isla Vista. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Antonio Cuna, a.k.a. Sweater Beats, opened for Purity Ring during the Warm-Up Concert hosted by Program Board. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

Purity Ring performed at the Warm-Up Concert in the Thunderdome, hosted by AS Program Board. Lorenzo Basilio/Daily Nexus

The festival did not end without leaving a mess, such as this house on Del Playa. Alex Gonzalez/Daily Nexus

Trash bins were full of empty boxes of food and alcoholic drinks. Alex Gonzalez/Daily Nexus

Houses such as this one on the corner of Camino del Sur and Pasado were left trashed. Sarah Kouklis/Daily Nexus

Students and community members worked together to remove trash from the streets on Sunday Morning, with the help of Adopt-a-Block. Paris Cullen/Daily Nexus

Hundreds of volunteers helped pick up trash off the streets on Sunday Morning. Paris Cullen/Daily Nexus

 

 

Print
Daily Nexus Photography

A cool team of photographers who preserves the visual memory of UCSB and Isla Vista.

The photo editor can be reached at photo@dailynexus.com.
